title: Time Travel to the Philippines, 1750
description: The year is 1750 in the Philippines, during a period marked by colonial rule and the beginning of significant environmental changes. Your decisions will impact the environment and influence the future of air quality in this diverse archipelago. Navigate your actions carefully:

choices.text: Implement sustainable farming practices by introducing terraced farming to prevent soil erosion.
choices.consequence: Adopting terraced farming not only prevents soil erosion but also reduces the need for slash-and-burn agriculture, leading to lower smoke emissions and a healthier ecosystem.

choices.text: Promote the use of galleon trade to export local goods using traditional sailing routes.
choices.consequence: While boosting the economy, reliance on galleon trade increases shipbuilding, leading to deforestation and higher CO2 levels due to the extensive use of wood for ships and transportation.

choices.text: Support the artisanal mining of gold using traditional methods, avoiding the use of mercury.
choices.consequence: This approach minimizes water pollution and avoids air quality degradation from mercury emissions, preserving the health of both local communities and the environment.

choices.text: Encourage the establishment of mangrove reforestation projects to protect coastal areas.
choices.consequence: Mangrove reforestation not only acts as a buffer against storms but also serves as a significant carbon sink, improving air quality and supporting biodiversity.
